com.sri.kernel.modules
Class ModuleLoader

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.kernel.modules.ModuleLoader
public class ModuleLoader
extends java.lang.Object

This provides the core module loading capability to the SR4 Kernel. Its purpose is to allow the loading and unloading of modules.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Constructor Summary

          Initializes the module loader with the given SR4 Kernel.

Method Detail

getModules

public ModuleList getModules()
Returns the module list

Returns:
The module list.

load

public void load(java.lang.String moduleName)
          throws ModuleDependencyException,
                 ModuleException
Loads the given module into the kernel. This outlines the loading process:
  1. Retrieve the module information for the given module
  2. Load the class specified by the module informations main class
  3. Instantiate the loaded class
  4. Resolve dependencies
  5. Initialize module through initModule with a reference to the module data object
  6. Perform a diagnostic on the module at level DIAG_BASIC
  7. Register all SRML Elements provided by the module
  8. Finish the loading process

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module to be loaded.
Throws:
ModuleDependencyException
ModuleException

unload

public void unload(java.lang.String moduleName)
            throws ModuleDependencyException,
                   ModuleException
This will attempt the given module. The module will not be unloaded if it does not exist, is not loaded, or is needed by another module. If the module can be unloaded it will unregister the provided SRML Elements, call unloadModule on the module, and remove any references to the module so it can be cleaned by the Garbage Collector.

Parameters:
moduleName - The name of the module to be unloaded.
Throws:
ModuleDependencyException
ModuleException

unloadAll

public void unloadAll()
               throws ModuleDependencyException,
                      ModuleException
This will unload all modules. All loaded modules will be forced unloaded.

Throws:
ModuleDependencyException
ModuleException
